summary: This is a Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General memorandum documenting a voluntary interview of Correctional Officer Tova Noel regarding the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on August 10, 2019. The document lists numerous attachments including interview transcripts, training records, and prison documentation from the time of Epstein's death.

persons.name: Tova Noel
persons.context: Correctional Officer assigned to the Special Housing Unit at MCC New York on August 10, 2019, the day Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell. Voluntarily interviewed by OIG agents.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: BOP inmate (Register Number 76318-054) who was found unresponsive in his cell at MCC New York on August 10, 2019, and subsequently died.

persons.name: Jason Foy
persons.context: Attorney from Foy & Seplowitz, LLC, present during Tova Noel's OIG interview as her legal representative.

persons.name: Eric Sarraga
persons.context: Attorney from Foy & Seplowitz, LLC, present during Tova Noel's OIG interview as her legal representative.

connections.description: Noel was a correctional officer assigned to the Special Housing Unit where Epstein was housed at the time of his death.
Foy served as Noel's legal representative during her OIG interview.
Sarraga served as Noel's legal representative during her OIG interview.
Both attorneys from Foy & Seplowitz, LLC representing Tova Noel.

events.title: OIG Interview of Tova Noel
events.description: Senior Special Agent and Special Agent from DOJ OIG conducted a voluntary interview of Correctional Officer Tova Noel regarding the death of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein Found Unresponsive
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, New York
Bergen County Bar Association, 15 Bergen Street, Hackensack, New Jersey
keyFacts: Tova Noel was a Correctional Officer assigned to the MCC New York Special Housing Unit on August 10, 2019, when Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell.
The OIG investigation interview of Noel was conducted voluntarily on June 22, 2021, with her attorneys and union representative present.
The document references extensive attachments including training records, assignment rosters, and prison documentation from the time of Epstein's death.
The interview was recorded and transcribed as part of the official OIG investigation into Epstein's death.
